author: Special Correspondent
text:
In the seven days since the announcement of elections to the State Assembly last Friday, a total of 1,342 complaints of violation of the model code of conduct have been received by Election Commission officials.

On Tuesday alone, 18 complaints were received from Coimbatore, Nilgiris, Tirupur, Virudunagar and Madurai districts and Rs.13 lakh cash without proper papers, Rs. 20,000 worth chemicals for making explosives and 30 litres of IMFL were sized by the flying squads.

Action has been taken on 28 complaints on political parties for not removing flags, banners and wall paintings and for opening party offices at public spots.

So far, a total of Rs. 37,98,530 cash has been seized by flying squads, said a press release here.
title: EC receives 1,342 complaints
